intro: Phacellaria compressa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phacellaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and has a distinctive, flattened stem. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Phacellaria compressa is often found in meadows and along the edges of woodland areas.
